words.prompt: Marvelous. The view from the mountaintop was marvelous. Marvelous.
Rhyme. Can you find a word that will rhyme with 'cat'? Rhyme.
Signature. Please put your signature on the dotted line. Signature.
Yacht. They sailed their luxury yacht across the ocean. Yacht.
Sincerely. Please sign the letter 'Sincerely yours'. Sincerely.
Available. Is this seat available? Available.
Issue. We need to discuss this important issue. Issue.
Broccoli. Broccoli is a healthy green vegetable. Broccoli.
Usually. I usually walk to school in the morning. Usually.
Disastrous. The earthquake had disastrous effects on the city. Disastrous.
Embarrass. Please don't embarrass me in front of my friends. Embarrass.
Environment. We need to protect the environment. Environment.
Physical. Running requires physical effort. Physical.
Actually. I thought it was Tuesday, but it's actually Wednesday. Actually.
Measure. Please measure the length of the table. Measure.
Absence. Your absence was noted at the meeting. Absence.
Scholarship. She received a scholarship to attend college. Scholarship.
Delicious. The cake was absolutely delicious. Delicious.
Furniture. We bought new furniture for the living room. Furniture.
Bargain. This shirt was a real bargain. Bargain.
Fountain. Children splashed in the park fountain. Fountain.
Individual. Each individual student received an award. Individual.
Surround. Tall trees surround the house. Surround.
Disappear. The magician made the rabbit disappear. Disappear.
Village. They live in a small village in the countryside. Village.
Mosquito. A mosquito buzzed around my head. Mosquito.
Fascinating. The documentary about space was fascinating. Fascinating.
Brilliant. The diamond shone with a brilliant light. Brilliant.
Ceiling. A fan hung from the ceiling. Ceiling.
Grammar. Good grammar is important for clear writing. Grammar.
Guarantee. The store offers a guarantee on all its products. Guarantee.
Marriage. They celebrated their fiftieth year of marriage. Marriage.
Peculiar. The fruit had a peculiar taste. Peculiar.
License. You need a driver's license to operate a car. License.
Messiah. Christians believe Jesus is the Messiah. Messiah.
Cashier. The cashier scanned the items at the checkout. Cashier.
Mileage. This car gets good gas mileage. Mileage.
Mortgage. They took out a mortgage to buy their house. Mortgage.
Pharaoh. The Pharaoh was the ruler of ancient Egypt. Pharaoh.
Parallel. Railroad tracks run parallel to each other. Parallel.
Abbreviation. 'Dr.' is the abbreviation for 'Doctor'. Abbreviation.
Antique. She collects antique furniture. Antique.
Reindeer. Santa's sleigh is pulled by reindeer. Reindeer.
Humid. The weather is hot and humid today. Humid.
Judgment. Use your best judgment when making the decision. Judgment.
Opposite. Black is the opposite of white. Opposite.
Mischievous. The mischievous kitten knocked over the vase. Mischievous.
Pyramid. We visited the ancient pyramid in Egypt. Pyramid.
